name: Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise

reviews.title: too expensive and problems with the bill
reviews.text: Apart from the fact that many things (food, pool, conference room) have been hardly four star standard, I experienced an incredible billing problem. First, I was charged too much. After I complained, it was admitted and I was reimbursed a certain amount of money. Amazingly, the staff was not able to tell me how they ended up with that amount, and still today I am waiting for a corrected bill.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: I have visited many hotels all over the world so far, and there have been little problems from time to time, but nothing even close to this case has ever happened to me.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel
Wonderful Place to Stay
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chateau earlier this year for 4 nights and were fortunate enough to be upgraded to the Belvedere Suite as we were on our honeymoon! The suite was a very well maintained duplex apartment with 2 bathrooms and has the only balcony in the hotel and the views are breathtaking! The staff we all very attentive and helpful especially at the conceirge desk who we had dealt with prior to arriving at the hotel. The food was superb - the Fairview Dining Room and Walliser Stube Restaurants are a must! We were at the hotel during the International Ice Sculpting Competition - although very interesting, the grounds and ice rink became very crowded and we had to escape for one of the days!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: Lake Louise Village itself is not worth visiting as there is little to see or do.
reviews.title: A wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: Overall a great hotel with amazing views (especially if the clouds lift enough to expose Mount Victoria and it's glacier!!!) Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful setting makes it worthwhile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Fairmont Lake Louise (LL) about 8 years ago. I was intrigued to check and see if the hotel has changed or improved in anyway. Some things don't change of course - the spectacular view of the Lake Louise and the surrounding mountains, the sprawling grounds of the hotel and the classic and stylishly furnished rooms.
reviews.title: Still good after all these years, though the signs of ageing are showing ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge and reception staff are still very responsive and seemed genuine in wanting to please their customers. I stayed in the Fairmont Gold Floor and had a "private" check-in. The staff at the Fairmont Gold Lounge were exceptional and went out of their way to "make things happen". I suppose that since it was the low season, they could give all their attention to the few guests who were staying on the club floor.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and scenery - as seen in winter time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room / suite was spacious (then again, it was one of the largest in the hotel) and fairly clean. I prefer modern and comfortable furniture. Unfortunately, the Fairmont LL management has opted for more "traditional", classic old world style furniture. The bed was unfortunately too soft for me and the pillows were not firm enough.
reviews.title: A bucket list place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping was responsive and passable.
reviews.title: This is the Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast at the lounge was not great though. Limited selection of food. After a day or so, it gets boring. The evening canapés and wines were nothing to be impressed with either.
reviews.title: Do the brunch... than walk it off
One of a Kind
reviews.text: We drive from Alaska to California every year in Oct and always just have a drink or take the obligatory lake photo... This year we decided to stay. In a word. ... Fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The service was outstanding, our room was great... It's all worth it. It's a truly international destination. Sure the views are breathtaking... The staff at the Chateau is what make the stay, superb. We were surprised that dogs are allowed... Only 35$ extra and they get your pooch a nice dog bed and treats! The clincher for us was the 24 hour 'deli'. Great great food and coffee 24/7...amazing. And the staff that works it are amazing. Not just deli food... Full hot meals- salads-sandwiches- desserts - coffee/espresso... Top notch, quick and you are eating gourmet food, in your great room ... In minutes. All the staff in all the outlets are warm and genuine.
reviews.title: Among the Rich & Famous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did not expect that level of great service. The beds are luxurious as are all the amenities. Pricey??? Whatever...can't afford it? Don't stay :)
reviews.title: Heaven in the Mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: ...from the front desk to to the housekeepers, the staff truly made the difference. Brenda Quinn from the Presidents Club was awesome
reviews.title: Fantastic view from my room!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The great attitude of the crew ...It must come from the top.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone must stay here at least once to experience the best experience of a lifetime. The staff bend over backwards to assist in any way. The rooms are spectactular and the location is magical.
reviews.title: A MUST DO!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is not cheap, and it shouldn't be, as you get what you pay for; the best experience in the most iconic of locations.
reviews.title: Beautiful view, excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Perfect clear afternoon on arrival for stunning views of the lake and glacier.... then 3 hours later snow and the next morning a snow dusted view!
reviews.title: Special Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It really blew our minds.
reviews.title: Amazing, Breathtaking, Stunning, Close to Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tis is our fourth trip to Banff and Lake Louise and the views are not the only reason. The hotel is a typical Fairmonf, with great food, great service and excellent location. It's the little things that makes this one of the most accommodating places we have stayed in the past 15 years. The restaurant while a little pricey, has excellent food and wine lost. The views are spectacular, I just wouldn't shop there as most of the shops have very expensive merchandise for what they carry. Definitely a 5 star resort.
reviews.title: Scenic indulgence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The room was perfectly appointed, fab bathroom, comfy bed and the view! Its all about the view. We canoed on the Lake and walked the grounds and it was just so beautiful. Of our two werk vacay ina Alaska and the Rockies, this was our daughter's favorite activity. I agree, I think Lake Louise is now in my top 3 most beautiful places. Also, the concierge was super helpful in getting dinner reservations. The kids staff was great as well, even though our daughter was the only one in attendance, they did a campfire and smores. I wish we could have stayed longer and done more of the kids activities, but our service was so great, I hope we can come back.
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning view with top notch service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you think you have stayed in luxury think again. We had a room over looking the lake and it was spectacular. The bed was like nothing else it was so comfortable. The restaurant was something else.the food was just beautiful and the service was excellent. Sunrise over the mountains above lake Louise was special and it is well worth going to. Treat yourself to a really beautiful holiday.
reviews.title: Amazing breathtaking 5 star luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a gorgeous old hotel with an amazing location and lots of outdoor activities...hiking trails, etc. Small rooms with big views. Friendly helpful staff who do their best to be accommodating. The restaurants are a bit expensive, but I guess that's to be expected.
reviews.title: Unforgettable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very memorable stay...much to do with the ethereal views. No complaints!
reviews.title: One of Canada's place to visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been hearing a lot of good reviews about Lake Louise and I listed this place as one of the places i really want to visit and i was not disappointed. The lake is stunning! We stayed in 7th floor and I would say that the staff is very attentive. The service was awesome and we love our room. It was an awesome experience staying in this hotel. I love the hiking trails and canoeing experience. Overall our experience at Fairmont was very good and would love to be back.
reviews.title: Breathtaking views you will not forget in a hurry !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Fairmont Lake Louise is a beautiful property, but the extreme understaffing caused a much less than satisfactory stay for us. Our room was not ready at check-in, even though there were many others successfully checking in who were not President's Club members. We could not secure restaurant reservations for the time we wanted, yet saw that the restaurant had many empty tables when we walked by. In fact, there were many empty tables each night that we dined. The Fairview dining room, which is billed as the "fine dining" restaurant, sorely lacked in a number of areas. The waitstaff, while very friendly, were unkempt in appearance, which is unacceptable in a fine dining establishment. The food was underwhelming, and one of our dinners was overcooked, although we were compensated with free drinks. On the bright side, all of the service people we came in contact with were quite friendly and eager to please. The room was small but lovely, and very clean, although exhaust fumes from the grill were often present on our floor (the 8th). We had a fine meal at the Poppy restaurant, and the deli, while expensive, was a convenient and tasty alternative to the $30 buffet breakfast. All in all we were glad we spent the money on this trip, but probably would not do it again unless Fairmont improves its service.
reviews.title: Beautiful location but extremely understaffed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here on a summer travel trip and will stay here again, if the chance presents. This is as good as any destination and hotel combination gets. You can just visit there but then you would feel stiffed knowing that you didn't spring for the big bucks and spend the night there. Really, one night is enough to get the full picture but if they have a deal to stay 3....it would be worth it. Your going to pay for all this 'stuff' but it is going to be a memory for me and my family that will never go away, like staying in a Holiday, Marriott or etc chain like place will. We had a room with a view but I ain't so sure that it is necessary. You can walk out the door and get the view, so if it is a lot cheaper....why pay the price. There is no place but there to eat but they do have a few medium price options........like having breakfast at the Deli or eating at the Glacier joint. Was good food all around and next time will likely spring for the German joint or the full dining options. Needless to say, the smell of this place is great and the ambience gets it full on.
reviews.title: It just don't get much better than this!!
A long held dream come true
reviews.text: What a setting! What a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live in Australia and had dreamed from afar for years of one day seeing this wonderful place. How lovely and how special!
reviews.title: Amazing views, great room, pricey mediocre food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the hotel - it was spectacular.
reviews.title: So Nearly Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: We were fortunate enough to stay at the Chateau on a regular basis during the 2012/13 Ski season . Most of our stays were on the Gold floor which quickly became our home away from home . Nothing was too much trouble for the fantastic concierge staff . Our young son was particularly impressed by having his own personal mini bathrobe waiting for him when we arrived . I cannot think of a single negative experience and would strongly recommend the Gold floor to both couples and families as a relaxing and informal place to stay. It goes without saying that a lake view room is a must . We have already booked and are looking forward to staying on the Gold floor next ski season .
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room could not have been more exquisite from the double doors into the bathroom to the mannequins that held our robes. The view to the glacier, when you could see it, was just beautiful. It snowed the entire time we were there and some spots of the lake were still frozen. We walked around with out umbrellas and enjoyed it so much. If you go In May don't expect any flowers yet, because it is way too cold. Outstanding attendants in every department. Food is excellent. We had a wake up call. they called and even sent the bellboy up to make sure I was up! One thing we borrowed some games from the front desk. if you didn't return them you were charged $50.00 per game,. Now the UNO card game was in such bad shape and wouldn't even stay in the card box. It should have been tossed long ago. The other game was not in much better shape. They did not have a domino set.
reviews.title: exquisite! We felt like royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Fairmont at a recent conference in room 182.
reviews.title: Breathtaking location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is simply breathtaking, from the aqua colored lake beside the hotel to the snow capped mountains surrounding it.
reviews.title: Perhaps the best hotel location in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lake is so close you can easily walk from the hotel in 2 minutes to it and then continue on the various walking trails.
reviews.title: Tiny windows, tiny rooms, beware of upgrades

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a hectic trip to the Canadian Rockies which included a three night stay at the Chateau Lake Louise, which was expected to be one of the he highlights of the holiday. First impressions of the Chateau and the service received as residents was first class and lived up to our expectations. However, we left with the impression that the Chateau is suffering from its own success, the areas of the hotel open to the public has turned the hotel into a shopping mall, making these areas of the hotel like a shopping precint available in any city.
reviews.title: Overall a wonderful stay at Chateau Lake Louise

likes.liked: — Remember that the Lake Louise attracts 10,000 per day - most of which pass through the hotel !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Similarly the beverage /dining facilities and services, were as you would expect to find in such a precint.
reviews.title: Good stay at Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: In contrast away from this environment the facilities and service can only be described as first class.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but not 5 star!

likes.disliked: — Other than the new wing, very run down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at The Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise in March 2006.
reviews.title: Beuatiful location, excellent service, but a little over priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Found the room and service excellent, all facilities were superb and we were very satisfied with the housekeeping. I would not choose to stay at the Chateau for an entire week again, simply because of it's isolated location. Whilst this might be a great bonus for a long weekend, it becomes slightly claustrophobic after several days.
reviews.title: Divine location, divine hotel
Nice Hotel! Great Views!
reviews.text: Expensive but very nice!! I would definitely recommend paying a little extra to have a room that overlooks the lake and glacier.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at CLL the day after a heavy snowfall that blanketed the area in a pristine winter condition and laden the trees with snow. Arriving around 2pm, the bellmen graciously took our luggage and they were delivered to our room before we arrived. Check-in was easy as the hotel was not busy on this three day weekend for many Americans. We were upgraded to a lake view room by a pleasant young woman at the desk. She was very informative and assisted us with our many questions. We immediately met with the concierge to arrange for skating, dog sledding and dinner reservations.
reviews.title: Spectacular Beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having worked in a railroad hotel in Montana, I understand that these hotels have their charm as well as issues. Rooms are often small with even smaller bathrooms. You may hear water rushing through pipes or creaky old stairs. Yet in our experience, we feel in love with the CLL for the pleasant service, comfortable room and fabulous view. The building and property are well maintained and the extension added in recent years does not deter from grandeur of this hotel.
reviews.title: Luxury in Louise - a little piece of Canadian history.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had a king bed, two chairs around a small table and flat screen TV. Small refrigerator that the note said was stocked was empty but allowed us to use the space. Bed was very comfortable and the heat was easily regulated. Bathroom had an old/refinished tub with good shower and water pressure. View from the room was spot on Lake Louise allowing us to see the skaters, sleigh rides, and majestic Rocky Mountains.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location!
Best location for ski
reviews.text: Dinner was in the Lake View lounge which has a light menu but great view of the snow covered trees (which are lighted at night) and lake. Service from the young staff was great and food o.k. Vidalia onion soup was great but Caesar salad was average.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Clearly, whoever named this hotel "Chateau" has never actually set foot in one.
reviews.title: Fabulous location... hotel is staggeringly overrated...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The approach isn't all it might be – our first thought was that it looked like a giant sprawling Embassy Suites, check-in is hectic if you arrive while the dozens of coach tours are checking in and the overall feel of the reception and ground floor bar/dining areas is that you have walked into a slightly run-down Disney resort :-(
reviews.title: You Pay for the View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had high hopes of this Fairmont hotel, having stayed in others which were as fabulous as one might expect for the price charged. Unfortunately, things didn't go well from the start – a promised early check-in didn't materialize (leaving one member of our 2-couple party stranded in reception for the best part of 4 hours - the rest of us were out white-water rafting for the day and had expected we were leaving our friend to check-in for us all).
reviews.title: Beautiful!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we were finally allocated rooms (we had booked Fairmont rooms) they were located in the older part of the hotel (not renovated since the 1980's). They were located down a dark dingy hallway with battered kick boards and doors with the most horrendous alpine flowers painted on them – it wasn't setting the scene we were hoping for! It got worse inside the rooms, however. The view was over the car-park (not a mountain at all) and faced the blank wall of an adjoining building. The bathrooms were so small you couldn't close the door if you were sitting on the toilet and the bath itself was a 1/2 bath – literally half a bath - so you couldn't have sat in it unless you were a person of challenged verticality. The photos online are not even vaguely representative of what you actually get – the rooms are dull, depressing, battered and seriously in need of refurbishment. As we were staying there for 3 nights these rooms were not an option for us and after much negotiation during the 4 hours our friend spent in reception - and during which he worked his way up the managerial chain we were finally moved to rooms in the new wing – into lake view junior suites. Now, it has to be admitted that these rooms were absolutely drop–dead gorgeous – as was the view – but you have to be willing to pay (at the time we visited in summer) at least $750 per night upwards to get what you might actually expect of a Fairmont chain.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are only going to spring for the Fairmont rooms – whether they overlook the lake or the mountain – you are going to be massively disappointed. Still, outside of our luxury suites the rest of the hotel was hugely disappointing in any event. There is only one reason to come here and that is for the view (and in our opinion access to the even more fabulously beautiful Moraine Lake a few minutes drive away).
reviews.title: The hotel is a typical Fairmont
Chateau Lake Louise not worth $600+
reviews.text: When we arrived around 5 p.m. our room wasn't ready. We were told we had a choice of an old room with a view of the Lake or a newer inside room. Of course we took the lake view room. For more than $600 we got a small dingy room with a tiny window overlooking the lake. The toilet seat was wobbly, the bathtub was grotty and because the bathroom door opened inward, it was hard to move around. The only bright spot was the Poppy Brasserie where we had the most delicious Alberta beef burgers. My advice: if you really want to stay here, book very early on and make sure you get a NEW room with a view. They're the same price as the dumpy rooms. Overall the Chateau is a cash grab coasting on the natural beauty of the lake.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights here in June. We had a fantastic time. Check-in went smoothly. We had a room on the top floor with a view of the lake. Our room was small but very comfortable and clean. We ate dinner at both the Victoria Room and the Fairview Room. Both meals were quite good, if expensive. We had a window table at both restaurants which was nice. The service was fine. The hotel itself is beautiful and the people who work there were very helpful and friendly. We felt that even though it is expensive to stay here, it is worth it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
A touch of luxury
reviews.text: We were a family of four adults on a tour of Western Canada in early July and had booked two de luxe rooms for 2 nights en route between Jasper and Edmonton. I booked through Expedia, knew that the hotel faced onto the famous Lake and we fancied a touch of relative luxury after more basic stays in Kamloops and Jasper on the way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: My initial impression was unfortunately unfavourable. It was like a zoo on arrival and the area outside reception was heaving with traffic- coaches and other cars arriving. A valet offered to park my car and explained that valet parking and self-parking cost the same ($27 a night!) but I declined. The queues were long at reception, the staff there gave the customer services patter but had glazed expressions and checking in took nearly 15 minutes because he had to do everything twice over because we had booked two rooms. He also failed to find us two adjoining rooms as requested; they were on separate floors.
reviews.title: Four Star +

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Hot and frustrated, I got back to the car and found the underground car park. I nearly lost my cool on getting to the rooms because my two de luxe rooms facing the Lake turned out to be in a fairly new extension. They did face the Lake but we could see very little of it because the main hotel block was in the way.
reviews.title: LOVE IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed one night in a room with a king bed, on the top floor, with view of Lake Louise. "Wow!" sums it all up.
reviews.title: Wow!!! Great room, with the most awesome view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, effective and attentive to details. The view was so beautiful that I didn't want to miss any of it, and ended up getting in-room dinner service. The food was excellent and the service professional and fast.
reviews.title: Sloppy and Careless Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was very cozy, extremely clean and the bed was very comfy.
reviews.title: Magical Christmas
Fabulous!
reviews.text: I took a walk around the Lake Louise: it's just sooo beautiful. Very peaceful. There was also a nice exhibit of ice sculptures in front of the Chateau. There's also a very nice fitness center, with an indoor pool, hot tub and steam room.

reviews.title: Fabulous!
reviews.text: This stay was by far one of the best of all of my trips... it just is so beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing could have prepared us for this. I had looked at the website 1000 times and read countless reviews, but I was still struck dumb when I first set my eyes on Chateau Lake Louise. Amazing. We upgraded to Fairmont Gold and were very pleased with our room - but even more pleased with the view. WOW! I have never seen anything like it in my life - a frozen lake, beautiful mountains, snow covered trees - pure, natural beauty. The service we received was excellent, as you would expect, staff remembered our name, which you wouldn't expect. It was incredible to walk on the Lake and watch the building of the ice lounge and ice castle. It really is the most magical place and we will definitely return!
reviews.title: Just like staying in a snow-globe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here December 9 -11 2009. It was -26 degrees Celsius, really cold!
reviews.title: Magical in winter
Best of the Best . . .
reviews.text: The bus/shuttle ride from Calgary Airport was 2 ½ hours and a long 2 ½ hours at that. However driving up to the Fairmont Hotel was like driving toward an oasis in the snow. It looked wonderful covered in snow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked a lake view suite. The room was a nice size for a hotel room, however it is not what I would image the size of a suite to be, this was about 2 metres deeper than the standard Fairmont room, but it did have a larger bath room with a separate shower and spa/Jacuzzi bath. The room was decorated in classic timber and wallpaper in theme with its era and was in good condition. I booked the suite on an advanced purchase deal from the Fairmont website; it was on a few dollars more and well worth it.
reviews.title: Chateau Lake Louise - wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all exceptional and went out of their way to wish my wife a Happy Birthday and presented her with a card at dinner. I did tip them off, but it was six months earlier. I was most impressed that they not only remembered but that gave her a lovely card as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and setting, some minor service issues.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could have stayed there.Instead we only stopped for coffee. The views from the hotel were priceless. The staff were very friendly and efficent. It was a little more expensive than I'd been used to, BUT it was well worth the money. A great location to get married.
reviews.title: If only...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairmont becuase of the reviews. It was definatly worth the money. This was our first time going through Banff and Jasper so we decided to stay. We were on a motorcycle and thought that we would be treated a bit different when we checked in becuase we had been on the road all day and it was hot so we were not very fresh. However we were treated with respect and courtisy. Service was excellent although the food was expensive.
reviews.title: Worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now here is the Fairmont with one of the best views in the world, the Magnificent green/blue Lake Louise, our second visit to the Chateau Lake Louise and just as good if not better than the first, It was nice to stay in the original wing where last time we stayed in the newer section of the hotel, We had a great room and there is just so much to do inside the building or going for a great walk around the lake.Fantastic food and really good service and highly recommend this quality hotel, we intend to return for our third visit in the next 3-4 years.
reviews.title: Spectacular View and has the wow factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is set in one of the scenic wonders of the world. The view from a lakeview room is beyond compare. The room was neatly appointed, clean, and the beds comfortable. The restaurants in the hotel were busy and hard to get into without reservation. The food was good, but expensive. My biggest gripe with such an expensive hotel is that you pay extra for everything, a 2 night stay and it cost $100 for self-parking and wifi and a martini was $16. In summary, feast your eyes and keep the wallet at hand, you'll need it often.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: stayed here with family during labor day weekend. the hotel has an excellent location with lake louise right in the backyard. there are a bunch of trails accessible from the hotel for the beginning hiker or the expert backcountry backpacker. activities at the hotel also include horseback riding and canoeing on lake louise.
reviews.title: Unbeatable Location, but needs better Room Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. We stayed for two nights and had a great time.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Fairmont sits on Lake Louise at the base of Victoria Glacier. There are several excellent hiking trails that start at the hotel and go around the lake and up toward the glacier, and other small lakes--Mirror and Agnes lakes. The location cannot be beat. Eating in the hotel restaurants you have a beautiful view of the lake and glacier. There is no reason to leave the property--all encompassing. The only drawback is the price. The room and food choices are expensive, but overall, it is worth it. They need to update the gym facilities too, but we were glad to have them at all, along with a nice indoor pool and large jacuzzi. It was a real treat to stay here, thanks!
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is always hard to rate. Third stay in 7 years, some consistencies: location, location, location. But yes, very expensive. Paid for a lakeview room for three nights and the view: it is breathtaking. Still no casual sort of restaurant ... ie a place to get a reasonably priced burger and fries for the kids on a weekday afternoon. Stayed on "Gold floor" for second time. You get an air conditioned room, and a guarantee your lakeview room is in the main building. (Yes, they consider some rooms in the new building that look across the street and trees lakeview but don't let talk you into it!!) Gold service is not at all what it was 7 years ago. No more omelettes, no more showing you to your room, no more being pro-active to see if you need dinner reservations. Breakfast on Gold floor is similar to a Hampton Inn. We thought we would treat ourselve to valet service this time, but could not get anyone to help us, so just self parked and saved money. Make sure you bring your AAA card , they do ask to see it!!

reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Chateau Lake Louise. It was our third stay at the hotel, and we will be back. Our room was clean, comfortable, and appropriately furnished. We enjoy the ambiance of this historic building. The staff was friendly and helpful, although rushed. We suspected that staffing was down with the return of many staff members to university classes. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My huband and I stayed here during our trip through the Canadian Rockies in May 2006. There was still a lot of snow, lakes were frozen and some of the roads still closed. But that doesn't mean that there isn't anything to do! We stayed here for 3 nights and it was just fantastic. It was really expensive so we initially booked a standard room with no lake view. When we arrived and checked in, we found out that we had been upgraded to a superior room and it was fantastic, huge room, huge bathroom - but still no lake view, but it was May and it did get dark early and we wouldn't have been able to see the lake anyway - so if you are planning a trip there before June, don't bother with the lake view - how much time will you really spend in your room when you are doing the Canadian Rockies anyway? The staff were excellent, always willing to help. We asked for their opinions on a few trips and they would always print out maps for us and tell us the best time to be there and the quickest route back. We ate in the hotel in the bar just once -it was okay. Good food around Lake Louise is hard to find, but other neighbouring hotels do well priced food if you are willing to jump in the car for a 10 minute journey. We didn't do breakfast either, we went to the village (another jump in the car but just for 5 minutes) where there is a cafe/bakery that does good coffee and bagels, sandwiches, muffins and pastries and it is good value for money. I also recommend the guided tours of the lake. There is one by the lake shore every day (check times with reception staff). They are free and very interesting. Also look out for wildlife when you are there, we saw a grizzly! When it was snowing one evening we also had a look around the shops in the hotel (the bookshop is good) and had a drink in the bar overlooking the lake at dusk. The only downside is the cost of the parking. It is expensive to park there - but a tip (if you don't mind a walk) is to park in the National Carpark near the entrance to the hotel (kind of near deer lodge) if you are staying there in the summer so you won't have to get stung $27 a day! This is a highly recommended hotel and definately worth the money (you only live once!)
reviews.title: Pure Dead Brilliant!!

likes.liked: — Location is unbeatable. Service is superb.

reviews.text: We have just returned from our honeymoon in Lake Louise and found the overall experience at the Fairmont to be very disappointing. On arrival at the hotel after travelling for 24hrs, we carried our own luggage through the snow from the bus to the check in desk - this wasn't something we expected from a 5 star hotel only to be checked in by some aggressive girl, calling herself a receptionist. We then again carried our luggage up to our room - this turned out to be a small dated room with 2 queen beds, broken door handle, damp cupboard and to add insult to injury, a plate of bruised fruit!! We opted for a delux room foolishly thinking that this would be a great room...however, this wasn't the case. We reported back to the receptionist suggesting that they'd allocated us into the wrong room as we'd paid (through the roof) for a delux room, but she replied that we were in the correct room and agreed with us that for the number of nights that we would be with them - 12 nights, this room would not be big enough and we should upgrade to a better room, of course for an additional cost!!! (what's another few hundred when you've already thrown thousands at them)

reviews.text: Upon checking in, to our surprise and delight, we were met by a staff member who accompanied us to our suite and presented us with a gift certificate. This was service above and beyond what is expected at even the finest of hotels. The service did not end there. We encountered a brake problem with our rental car and attempted to exchange it at the Hertz counter, but they had no vehicles available and the best they could offer was to send one from Calgary the following day, which would have required us to cancel our planned trip to the ice fields. However, the hotel volunteered to provide immediate limousine transportation to the Banff Fairmont, a one hour drive, to pick up a replacement car. Once again, the service was unexpected, extraordinary and greatly appreciated. Beyond the impressive level of service, we found the meals at the various restaurants in the hotel to be excellent. We also used concierge services a number of times, and always encountered friendly, competent responses.

reviews.text: I attended a conference at Chateau Lake Louise and took a couple of extra days there with my wife. We had a room in the Mt Temple wing, facing the lake - it was a great view, and the room was in good condition, seemed relatively new. The bathroom had high-end fixtures and was a good size. The breakfast buffet is expensive, but very good. Overall, prices are high, and this is compounded by the fact that you have to buy a park pass for the time you are staying there, and parking is $25-30 per day. However, we found the staff very friendly and helpful, and the location was spectacular. There is a pleasant 2k hike to the end of the lake which is very scenic. The hotel is 4-5k from the village, so if you don't have a car, you are kind of stuck there, although there is lots to do there. My only complaint is the fitness centre. It has only 2 treadmills and 2 bikes and a couple of other machines, which is kind of crazy for hotel with 500+ rooms.

Many places to eat right there on the property, including a deli where you can pick up sandwiches for a picnic while hiking. And who can argue with the view? Lake Louise is absolutely breathtaking. Our room had no air conditioning, but we were furnished with a fan. of course, the prices reflect that you pay for all of this scenic beauty and service.

I was nearly blinded by snow but the view was breathtaking.

reviews.text: Stu was waiting on the gold floor to greet us and take us to our room which was gorgeous. I think it was in the turret and was large and spacious with a huge bathroom and a view of the lake. Stu suggested we eat in the Glacier Saloon.

reviews.title: Dont waste your money
reviews.text: The meal was just what we wanted - a large plate of nachos and an excellent bottle of reasonably priced wine. The service was very good indeed and we relaxed and enjoyed a casual late dinner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: My wife and two teenage sons stayed at the Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise for a week during early March, 2006.
reviews.title: Why Are People Whining About This Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: The only complaint I have about this place is that it is difficult to get to. In fact, we travelled for 14 hours from Miami to Calgary. Then the shuttle bus took another three hours to get to the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect!
HATE THE SERVICE
reviews.text: We arrived at 3:00 A.M. and the enormous lobby of the hotel was empty The Fairmont Lake Louise in some ways is reminiscent of the hotel featured in the "Shining." Its a huge beautiful place. You need a good wide angle lens to get a decent picture of the structure.

reviews.title: beautiful in the spring time
reviews.text: Once we did find hotel staff, the rest of our stay was delightful. Contrary to the other critics writing reviews, we found the service to be extraordinary. Definitely no South Beach attitude here. Unfortunately, I had to conduct some business on this trip and the hotel staff could not have been more accommodating with my messages and faxes I received in my room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005
reviews.text: The two boys were upgraded to a junior suite which was well furnished and roomy. My wife and I shared a deluxe room adjacent to the children's room. The view from our room, which was at the very end of the hallway was enchanting. One view faced Lake Louise head on. The other view faced a lovely unobstructed mountain.
reviews.title: Winter Paradise!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending an amazing couple of weeks in Canada and being thrilled by the service, we were extremely disappointed by the level of service in the Fairmont at Lake Louise. It is in a perfect location with incredible views and access to Lake Louise, but the hotel itself could do with a refurb (it looks pretty dated and the rooms are not that nice - plus the aircon was dreadful whilst we were there). Worse was the service which bordered on being rude, which you would not expect at a 4/5 star hotel. Very disappointing.
reviews.title: Great location, poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We merely planned to have a leisure walk along the lake from the Hotel ... We finally took a one hour hiking with scenic views to look back at the Chateau and discovered that there were more challenging hiking routes offered to the Six Galciers in the area. Besides the natural astonishing environment around the Fairmont Hotel, they did put more effort to beautify her surroundings with plantations and amenities ! The perfect and whole hearted guest services offered, of course, was a must to us, just ordinary and free club members.
reviews.title: What else Do you want ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't decide between the Chateau Lake Louise or the Banff Springs Hotel. Both are lovely properties - but I'm glad we chose the Chateau!
reviews.title: An excellent choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a beautiful, elegant, old-world hotel with lots of charm and lots of attention to service and detail. Yes, there are lots of tourists. But it is summer in Canada, the weather is gorgeous, and who can blame them - this is one of the most beautiful spots on the planet!
reviews.title: Absolutely breathtaking view and accommodations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room (7th Floor) was lovely. Quiet, comfortable, great amenities. One of the best Concierge Lounges I've ever been to.
reviews.title: We felt like royalty

aka: Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise Hotel Lake Louise
description: Surrounded by some of the most breathtaking scenery in the world, the iconic Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise resort is nestled deep within Banff National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Enveloped by soaring mountain peaks, the majestic Victoria Glacier and a glistening emerald lake, the natural beauty of this destination permeates every nook of the historic resort - originally built as a base for outdoor enthusiasts and alpinists. The Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise is a year-round luxury resort which specializes in offering extensive Guided Mountain Heritage programs, unparalleled skiing in the winter, exceptional food and beverage experiences and a new spa, The Spa at the Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise.
